title: Comparative Study of Spike Encoding Methods for Environmental Sound Classification
author: Andres Larroza (Instituto Tecnológico de Informática), Javier Naranjo-Alcazar (Instituto Tecnológico de Informática), Vicent Ortiz Castelló (Instituto Tecnológico de Informática), Pedro Zuccarello (Instituto Tecnológico de Informática), ...
relevance_why: The focus on spike encoding for environmental sounds could provide insights into new encoding techniques for audio tasks, paving the way for further innovations in generative audio and sound processing.
background: Environmental sound classification involves identifying and categorizing sounds from various environmental sources, which can be complicated by background noise and overlapping acoustics.
contribution: This paper introduces a comparative analysis of three spike encoding methods to solve the challenge of classifying environmental sounds, achieving improved performance with the Threshold Adaptive Encoding method.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods focus primarily on traditional audio classification techniques, often ignoring the unique characteristics of environmental sounds.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work evaluates and benchmarks different spike encoding methods, emphasizing the suitability of spiking neural networks for environmental sound classification.

key_innovation: The use of Threshold Adaptive Encoding shows superior performance in minimizing misclassifications during environmental sound classification tasks.
real_world_impact: By establishing benchmarks for spike encoding in environmental sound classification, this study can enhance real-time sound recognition applications in fields such as surveillance and monitoring.
limitations: The study does not explore SNN architecture modifications that may further optimize performance for more complex audio tasks.

new_terms.spike encoding: **Spike encoding** is a method of converting continuous signals into discrete events called spikes, mimicking the way biological neurons communicate.
new_terms.Threshold Adaptive Encoding: **Threshold Adaptive Encoding** is a dynamic spike encoding method that adjusts the threshold for spikes based on signal characteristics, offering improved robustness and sensitivity.
